content: in this legal case a court ruled that the claimant is responsible for covering the procedural costs but the specific amount was not specified the claimants alternative claim for the division of an estate and the sale of a property was dismissed the property was sold at a public auction and the remaining funds were divided equally between the claimant and the defendant to cover the enforcement procedure costs another partys counterclaim was also dismissed the courts decision can be appealed within 30 days if the appellant wants a court hearing they must indicate so in their appeal the court explains the process for requesting procedural aid the parties involved can submit their claims and objections the court rejected the claimants request to become the sole owner of the properties but granted the defendants counterclaim for a public auction to divide the properties the claimant is responsible for the procedural costs the order from the tartu district court has been partially canceled
